repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: The Nāṟkaraṇavupatēcam, "Teaching on the four karaṇams", which appears to be a lesson on the four karaṇams, that is, the four organs of perceptions.

collation.desc: 9 folios = Nāṟkaraṇavupatēcam. Tamil foliation {1}‒9. f9v blank.

additions.desc: Marginal and in-text benedictions; marginal title; nūl varalāṟu; text completion statement.

origin.origDate: No internal date. The bundle is dated to circa 1840 by Vinson (1867) and to 1840 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments). Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 2, no. 4.
Rosny, Léon de. 1868. La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In: Variétés orientales, 177‒224. Paris: Maisonneuve.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 1r, no. 4.

Vinson, Julien. 1868. Manuscrits tamouls. Proofreadings of the catalogue for Tamoul 1-204 (old shelfmark). Printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)”. — See p. 1, no. 4. — The same proofreadings with black ink handwritten corrections are found in Vinson et al. (1866-, f1-f49).

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings between separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
